channel.title: Not Equal to Operator?

item.title: Not Equal to Operator?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:4, topic:341049”][quote author=DawnOfDusk link=topic=437443.msg3214843#msg3214843 date=1274585114]
…thats weird. But thank you.
[/quote]

If you look at each character one by one, it somewhat makes sense. If “i is less than 5 and greater than 5”, is the same thing as “i not equal to 5”. Just a different syntax. I know most, if not all BASIC languages use <> rather than !=[/quote]you mean if “i is less than 5 or greater than 5”

Read full topic

item.title: Not Equal to Operator?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

DawnOfDusk:

…thats weird. But thank you.

If you look at each character one by one, it somewhat makes sense. If “i is less than 5 and greater than 5”, is the same thing as “i not equal to 5”. Just a different syntax. I know most, if not all BASIC languages use <> rather than !=

item.title: Not Equal to Operator?
item.dc:creator: @DawnOfDusk DawnOfDusk
item.description:
@DawnOfDusk wrote:

So I have this lil basic bit of code…

program New;
var
i:Integer;
asdf: String;
begin
     i:= StrToInt(Readln(asdf));
     if(i = 5) then
     begin
          Writeln('input is not equal to 5');
     end else
     begin
          Writeln('input is equal to 5');
     end;
end.

Basically, I want it to read…

if(i != 5) then
//Not equal to

I know you can use end else, but I want to know if the not equal to operator is available in scar? (I would think so… idk)

Read full topic
